abstract.text: A setting for whether to fire the flash when capturing photos.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The default value for this setting is
This setting supersedes the deprecated
property. When using the
class, the capture device’s flash mode doesn’t apply—use this property on your photo settings object instead.
Assuming a static scene, using the
setting is equivalent to testing the
property (which indicates whether flash is recommended for the scene currently visible to the camera), and then setting the

property of your photo settings output accordingly before requesting a capture. However, the visible scene can change between when you request a capture and when the camera hardware captures an image—the automatic setting ensures that the flash is enabled or disabled appropriately at the moment of capture. When the capture occurs, your
methods receive an
object whose
property indicates which flash mode was used for that capture.
When the device becomes very hot, the flash becomes temporarily unavailable until the device cools down (see the
property). While the flash is unavailable, a photo output’s
property still reports the
and
options as available, so you can still enable the flash in your photo settings even when the flash is temporarily unavailable.
When the photo output calls your
methods, check the
property of the provided
to verify whether the flash is in use.
When specifying a flash mode, the following requirements apply:
The specified mode must be present in the photo output’s
array.
You may not enable image stabilization if the flash mode is
. (Enabling the flash takes priority over the
setting).
The capture output validates these requirements when you call the
method. If your settings don’t meet these requirements, that method raises an exception.

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that represents a hardware or virtual capture device like a camera or microphone.
Constants that specify the flash modes of a capture device.
A mode that indicates the device continuously monitors light levels and uses the flash when necessary.
A mode that indicates the flash is off.
A mode that indicates the flash is on.
The device’s current flash mode.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the flash is currently available for use.
Methods for monitoring progress and receiving results from a photo capture output.
A capture output for still image, Live Photos, and other photography workflows.
Initiates a photo capture using the specified settings.
A Boolean value indicating whether the scene currently being previewed by the camera warrants use of the flash.
The flash settings this capture output currently supports.
A specification of the features and settings to use for a single photo capture request.
A setting for whether to fire the flash when capturing photos.
A Boolean value that specifies whether the photo output, at its discretion, uses content-aware distortion correction on this photo request.
A Boolean value that specifies whether captures automatically combine data from a dual camera device.
A Boolean value that indicates whether to use auto red-eye reduction on flash captures.
A Boolean value that specifies whether captures use automatic image stabilization.
A Boolean value that specifies whether to use automatic virtual-device image fusion.
A Boolean value that determines whether a dual photo capture also delivers camera calibration data.
A Boolean value that determines whether a dual camera device delivers images from both cameras.
A Boolean value that specifies whether to capture still images at the highest resolution supported by the active device and format.
The maximum resolution of the photo to capture.
A setting that indicates how to prioritize photo quality against speed of photo delivery.
The constituent devices for which the virtual device should deliver photos.
A description of the features and settings in use for an in-progress or complete photo capture request.
A Boolean value indicating whether the camera flash fires for this capture.
